page.title: 15THE CHURCH
page.content: The church is of Norman origin. Three Norman arches remain today which were built in 1186. Towards the end of the 14th century the Norman church was replaced by a perpendicular style of architecture around 1390. There is a story that when Cromwell rode through {S.K.}after the battle of Naseby he asked why a statue above the church door had not been destroyed. One of his troopers replied"It is only old Nick sir,so we left him". In the 19th century the rector had an observatory built at{S.K.}He was one of the co-founders of the Royal Astronomical Society.He was also responsible for the erection of the church school in 1851 .The school was rebuilt at a cost of Â£225 ,the church was rebuilt except for the tower and Norman arches at a cost of Â£1,850.
